description.narrative: Jamaica Acceded to the Vienna Convention for the Protection of the Ozone Layer and the Montreal Protocol on Substances that Deplete the Ozone Layer, and its London Amendment on 31March 1993. The country subsequently acceded to the Copenhagen Amendment on 6 November 1997, and the Montreal and Beijing Amendments on 24 September 2003. Jamaica is classified as an Article 5 country under the Protocol. Jamaica completely phased out the consumption of Annex A, Group 1 Chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) in 2006 and has commenced the process of phasing out consumption of Annex C, Group 1 Hydro-chlorofluor
capital of a political entity

description.narrative: Justice Undertakings for Social Transformation

This compoenent will focus on technical legal assistance and training the Ministry of Justice (MOJ), the office of the Direcotr of Prosecutions (ODPP) and the Court Management Services (CMS) to address a wide range of matters aimed at improving the organizations, management, and service delivery capacity of these institutions. The outputs are: 1.1 Justice reform resources consolidated, streamlined and coordinated 1.2 RBM Tools introduced and practices adopted 1.3 Policy development capacity of the MOJ strengthened 1.4 Participatory monitoring processes integrated in justice reform and moderni
capital of a political entity
Justice, Law and Order - policy, planning and administration

This component will focus on the strengthening the technical and results based management capacity of the Ministry of Justice (MOJ) to undertake policy development, planning and implementation of justice reform initiatives. The outputs are: 2.1 Standards of professional conduct for prosecutors introduced and implemented 2.2 Standard operating procedures for the exercise of prosecutorial functions and decision-making developed and implemented 2.3 Prosecutorial training and professional development plans and programmes developed and implemented 2.4 Human Resources protocols and strategies devel
capital of a political entity
Justice, Law and Order - policy, planning and administration
3.1 Court management and governance strategies developed and implemented 3.2 Measures undertaken to improve the efficiency of the Court System
capital of a political entity
Justice, Law and Order - policy, planning and administration

Justice Canada InterChange Agreement under the Justice Undertakings for Social Transformation (JUST) Program in Jamaica is to help facilitate funds and management arrangements for Department of Justice Canada
capital of a political entity

The JUST Programme will seek to streamline and improve the legislative drafting process. The Programme will work to strengthen the organization and operations of the Office of the Parliamentary Council (OPC), which is the department with responsibility for writing Jamaica’s statutes and regulations. Outputs are: 4.1 Standard operating procedures for developing legislation and issuing drafting instructions in place 4.2 Changes needed to modernise Law Reform systems and processes identified 4.3 Changes needed to modernise criminal law and practice identified for Cabinet approval
capital of a political entity
Justice, Law and Order - policy, planning and administration

This component will facilitate involvement of Jamaican non-governmental organizations and will focus on assisting the government to restore public order and trust in the formal institutions of the justice system. The primary focus will be on initiatives aimed at improving the capacity of communities and civil society to participate in justice reform and the promotion of public order
capital of a political entity
Justice, Law and Order - policy, planning and administration

Output 1.1: National Strategy for Development Effectiveness in Jamaica developed 1. The National Strategy for Development Effectiveness completed 2. National Consultative Workshop completed
Output 1.2: Monitoring and evaluation capacity of the government and counterparts enhanced 1. 90% 2. 80% of the quarterly reports collected by the CO deadline 3. 80 persons 4. 80% of requests for TA fulfilled
Output 1.3: GOJ officials in Ministries, Department and Agencies (MDAs) have specialised knowledge in strategic areas 1. At least 50% of GOJ requests for specialised training for officials facilitated. 2. Participation in two(2) international conferences per year
Output 1.4: Project Management skills of government and counterparts enhanced 1.Thirty five (35) related staff from government and counterparts trained on Project Management Skills 2.Eighty (80) % of relevant entities represented
Output 1.5: Capacity to localize Sustainable Development Goals within the framework of national development agenda strengthened 1. Min 2 forums per year 2. Agreed activities fully completed 3. Fully established 4. Online training developed 5. At least 1 per year
Output 2.1: CO pipeline of development solutions aligned to current and emerging national development challenges 1. Two project proposals developed for submission funding per year 2. Two sessions per year
Output 2.2: Resource mobilization capacity for consolidating the CO pipeline increased 1. At least 2 forums held to discuss and share knowledge and experience 2. 50% of the proposals secure funding

Output 1.1 The National Strategy for Development Effectiveness completed and validated with having conducted the National Consultative Workshop. Output 1.2 Enhancing Monitoring and evaluation capacity of the government and counterparts continued throughout the year; Both government and implementing partners provided with RBM support; A prototype Monitoring Framework for External Cooperation Management Division of Planning Institute of Jamaica was developed. Support provided to improve the M&E framework of the Community Renewal Programme of government. 100% requests for M&E support fulfilled. Output 1.3 GOJ officials in Ministries, Department and Agencies (MDAs) have specialised knowledge in strategic areas: Two officials were assisted to attend international training/conference/meetings. Output 1.4 Project Management skills training for government was not implemented since the alignment of the training to that of the Public Investment Management System. Output 1.5 Strengthening Capacity to localize Sustainable Development Goals within the framework of national development agenda continued. Social Good Summit to enhance youth participation in Technology innovation was held. Also the launch of the Caribbean CDR and the SDG conference were launched. Online training on Human Rights is being implemented. Output 2.2 Sustainability Plan to replicate Risk Reduction Management Centres at Parish level was developed for resource mobilization.

title.narrative: TNC and BUR to the UNFCCC

description.narrative: Preparation of Third National Communication and Biennial Update Report for Submission to the United Nations Framework Convention for Climate Change

title.narrative: TNC and BUR to the UNFCCC

description.narrative: This project will support the preparation of its Third National Communication (TNC) and First biennial Update Report (BUR) for the implementation of its obligations under the UN Framework Convention for Climate Change. This will mainly include conducting national inventory of greenhouse gas emissions, assessing national circumstances, gaps, constraints and financial and technical capacity needs for improving capacity and implementing actions needed to address climate change issues both in terms of mitigation as well as adaptation and reduction vulnerability.
capital of a political entity

Ultimate Outcome 0.1. Status of completion of TNC Report (not started, partially complete, fully completed) 0.2. Status of completion of BUR Reports (not started, partially complete, fully completed) Outcome 1 1.1. Number of stakeholder consultations conducted in support of data gathering Outcome 2 2.1. Status of completion of GHG Inventory and emission data (not started, partially complete, fully completed) 2.2 Status of identification of national institutional arrangements and frameworks for domestic MRV 2.3 Status of development of GHG database 2.4. No. of costed mitigation project concepts developed. Outcome 3 3.1. Number of sectors with programmes, plans and actions developed to facilitate adaptation to CC 3.2. Number of sectors with case studies on vulnerability and adaptation to CC impacts 3. Number of climate scenarios developed Outcome 4 4.1. Status of update on LEAP Model data (no update, partially updated, fully updated) 4.2 Status of Completion of national mitigation strategy (not started, partially completed, fully completed) 4.3 Status of assesments of the impact of CC mitigation measures on national development (not started, partially completed, fully completed). 4.4 Status of setting up project management unit in the climate Change Division (not started, partially completed, fully completed) Outcome 5 5.1.Status of attendance of the jamaican delegation at the conference of Parties to the UNFCCC 5.2. GHG inventory and emissions data for 200-2005 2.2 No national institutional arrangements or frameworks for domestic MRV exist 2.3 No national database for GHG inventory exists 2.4. No costed project concepts on mitigation available Outcome 3 3.1. No updates on programmes, plans and actions for 5 sectors available 3.2. Case studies on 5 communities vulnerability and adaptation and CC impacts (exclusive of gender component) 3. Climate projections for 2015, 2030 and 2050 Outcome 4 4.1. Mitigation assessment with 2000 data using the LEAP model 4.2 No national mitigation strategy 4.3 No assessments of impact of CC mitigation measures on national development 4.4 No unit exists Outcome 5 5.1.Support to annual participation of the Jamaican delegation to the UNFCCC COP since 2009 5.2. Eight pre-COP preparation and post-COP debreifing sessions held since 2009 Outcome 6 6.1. SNC completed and submitted to UNFCCC

title.narrative: Deployment of Renewable Energy and Energy Efficiency

description.narrative: This project seeks to advance a low carbon development path and reduce Jamaica’s public sector energy bill through the introduction of renewable energy (RE) and improvement in energy efficiency (EE) in the health sector.

title.narrative: DraftProDoc-Deployment of Renewable Energy and Improvement of Energy Efficiency Project
Consultancy to assess the Sustainable Energy Education at the Post-Secondary Level in Jamaica
Consultancy to conduct a tailored training program on Renewable Energy and Energy Management for Public health Facilities in Jamaica

description.narrative: To build relevant capacity in the public sector by increasing the knowledge base of its operatives on matters pertinent to RE and EE as well as developing the appropriate technical skills necessary to support investments in the sector.
capital of a political entity
Energy - power generation

description.narrative: Reintegration and Rehabilitation of Involuntary Returned Migrants in Jamaica

title.narrative: Consultancy to Conduct Study on Involuntary Returned Migrants in Jamaica
Project Coordinator - IRM - Reintegration and Rehabilitation of Involuntary Returned Migrants in Jamaica Project

description.narrative: The main objective of the project is to develop and strengthen the national and local system to enable an increase in the number of deported persons that have access to adequate social services, jobs and livelihood opportunities in Jamaica.
Anti corruption

1.1 Baseline Study and spatial mapping on deported persons completed. 1.2 Deportation Policy completed. 1.3 Minimum Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) on reintegration and rehabilitation of returned migrants completed. 1.4 Reintegration and rehabilitation strategy completed. 2.1 Terms of Reference for National Technical Working Group (NTWG) on Deportation completed. 2.2 Two (2) workshops and six (6) quarterly meetings of the NTWG held; (b)Roadmap and Action Plan for NTWG completed; (c) Thirty percentage (30%) of NTWG members are men. 3.1 Capacity assessments for NGOs completed. 3.2 Thirty (30) participating service providers trained; (b) Fifty (50) IRMs trained; (c) Thirty percent (30%) of participants are women and other vulnerable groups. 3.3 One (1) NGO provided with equipment to strengthen income generation. 4.1 Two (2) stakeholder consultations held to validate framework protocol; (b) Fifty (50) percentage of participants are women and other vulnerable groups. 4.2 Framework and Protocol for tracking the reintegration of returned migrants completed. 5.1 Four (4) training sessions conducted to improve service delivery to returned migrants by local authorities; (b) Fifty percent (50%) of participants are women and other vulnerable groups. 5.2 Two (2) public education materials developed (disaggregated by type). 5.3 Strategy for including reintegration of returned migrants in LSDP process completed. 5.4 Sustainability strategy for Parish safety and Security Committees completed.

description.narrative: Outcome 1 will seek to strengthen local governance bodies to design and implement community development plans allowing the community to be more organized in its prevention and response to human security issues. Objective one is at the core of the work to be done, the assumption is that once capacity is built across the sectors at both local and national level, the results will be sustained.

description.narrative: Outcome 4 seeks to mainstream the human security approach into development strategies. There will be a focus on integration of this approach at both National and Subnational which will include the development of a case study and guidelines based on the results and lessons of the intervention for applying a human security approach to address the multidimensional issues facing the communities. With other complementary initiatives being implemented, the Joint Team will place emphasis on evaluating the approach and the specific strategies to inform other efforts and plans for replication. title.narrative: Initiation Plan for Ratification of Kigali Amendment
